title: Ex-NASCAR driver Biffle, family die in plane crash
content: Former NASCAR driver Greg Biffle and his family were among seven people killed in a plane crash Thursday in Statesville, North Carolina.

title: Sources: Padres sign King to 3-year, $75M deal
content: Right-hander Michael King and the San Diego Padres agreed to a three-year, $75 million contract, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan on Thursday.

title: Ohio: Smith fired over affair with student, drinking
content: In an intent to terminate letter, Ohio University's president wrote that football coach Brian Smith's "extramarital affairs," including one with a student, brought "disrepute, scandal and ridicule," which violated his employment agreement.

title: Pari nagaswaram and musical tradition of Thyagarajaswamy Temple in Tiruvarur
content: The Pari nagaswaram is traditionally played only at the Tiruvarur temple, by a single family, which has held the right for generations. The instrument is tuned to madhyama kala sruti, requiring extraordinary lung power to play ‚Äî almost 3 times as that needed to play a regular nagaswaram. It also produces an exceptionally powerful sound

content: Patanjali Foods has approached the Bombay High Court alleging that a YouTube video falsely claims its¬†Nutrela¬†Soya Chunks failed safety tests.¬†¬†

title: Sekkipatti: where Muslims receive temple honours and Hindus worship, make offerings at a¬†dargah
content: Sekkipatti, a village in Melur taluk in Madurai, is a primarily agrarian village that serves as one of the best examples of religious harmony between Hindus and Muslims that can be seen in southern Tamil Nadu. In the village, there is no discrimination between the two communities, and a traditional familial kinship has existed throughout the years

title: When two warring groups of the Congress met in Thirupparankundram for talks 80 years ago
content: While one faction was headed by TNCC president K. Kamaraj, the other was led by veteran leader C. Rajagopalachari. The conference debated on the formal re-entry of the latter into the organisation after he left following differences with Mahatma Gandhi and others over the Muslim League‚Äôs demand for the creation of Pakistan

title: Could rewiring macrophage metabolism make TB treatments shorter?
content: Indian researchers have reported that macrophage metabolism shapes the tolerance of the TB bacterium to drugs; by pushing infected immune cells to generate energy using glycolysis, they were able to render bacteria more vulnerable

content: Indian exporters are successfully mitigating the impact of U.S. market losses by rapidly diversifying into alternative global markets

content: Channapatna and Kinnal in Karnataka are known for the unique toys generations of artisans have been making and enjoy Geographical Indicator tags. But the craft in these towns face an existential crisis as the younger people in the toy-making families are choosing jobs in cities, reports Rishita Khanna.

content: Why Samji Arattupuzha‚Äôs new song feels like Christmas at a Kerala Church. He has over 500 Christian devotional songs to his credit

content: Chief Electoral Officer Archana Patnaik is scheduled to address a press conference in Chennai on Friday afternoon regarding the publication of the integrated draft electoral roll.

content: Forms received by the deadline will be included in the draft electoral roll, scheduled for publication on December 23

content: Advocate-General P.S. Raman, representing the State, told the court that the State had not formed an opinion on the stone pillar, and did not wish to take a stand on the matter

content: The Indian Air Force is a technologically advanced, operationally agile, strategically confident and future-oriented force, he says at Commanders‚Äô Conclave in New Delhi

content: Sanjay Malhotra, who was on a visit, urged the institute to strategise scalability and impact amid evolving tech landscape, changing needs of banking sector

content: Best remembered for the Statue of Unity, the prolific sculptor was known for his realistic portraits of national icons in bronze and stone

content: Screenings of six films - Yes, Eagles of the Republic, Clash, Flames, A poet: Unconcealed Poetry, and All That's Left of You were cancelled

content: Union Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal was responding to a question by Congress president and Rajya Sabha MP Mallikarjun Kharge

content: The Enforcement Directorate investigation revealed that funds mobilised from lakhs of investors were utilised for the acquisition of these 169 immovable properties

content: Justice Manoj Gupta of the Allahabad High Court was proposed for appointment as the Chief Justice of the Uttarakhand High Court, consequent upon the retirement of incumbent Chief Justice on January 9, 2026

content: Couple say they had petitioned the Chief Minister, the State Human Rights Commission, and the Information Commission, but to no avail

title: Trade unions, farmers‚Äô outfits demand withdrawal of SHANTI Bill
content: The measure will dismantle India‚Äôs carefully built nuclear safety and accountability framework and open the most hazardous energy sector to large-scale private and foreign participation, they say

content: The panel says New Delhi could end up losing the ‚Äústrategic space‚Äù in Dhaka without necessary recalibration

title: Experts call for neuro-justice framework in motor accident cases
content: While India recorded about 1.77 lakh road accident deaths in 2024, official statistics do not capture the far larger number of survivors left with lifelong neurological disabilities following head, spinal cord, and nerve injuries

title: Mob vandalises prayer hall over burial dispute in Bastar
content: Clashes in Kanker village follow opposition to Christian burial rites; police personnel among those injured in mob fury

title: NIA arrests another key accused in Delhi car bombing
content: Yasir Dar was allegedly in close contact with the other accused in the case, including Umar-Un-Nabi, as well as Mufti Irfan

title: Sahitya Akademi cancels awards announcement following directive from Culture Ministry
content: The Ministry had sent a note to the Akademi, reminding it of an MoU signed in July that an exercise of restructuring of awards needed to be taken in consultation with the Ministry

title: No ‚Äòdirect‚Äô link between air pollution and lung disease: Minister
content: Says air pollution is one of the ‚Äòtriggering factors‚Äô for respiratory ailments and associated diseases.

title: Assembly passes resolutions demanding Centre act to alleviate backwardness plaguing NK
content: The resolutions are aimed at bringing pressure on the Centre to fund long-pending projects in North Karnataka region

title: Of 202 Indian recruits in Russian Army, 26 killed, seven missing, MEA tells Rajya Sabha
content: The Ministry of External Affairs says it has assisted in two cremations in Russia, transport of mortal remains of 10 Indians who died there; got early discharge for 119 Indians, working on the discharge of 50 more

title: Population Management Policy will be introduced in A.P. by Ugadi, says CM
content: A Cabinet Sub-Committee will be formed to help curb malicious propaganda and fake accounts used on social media for character assassination, says Naidu ¬†

title: Watch: India worst doping offender for third straight year, says WADA report
content: India ranked first globally in doping violations for the third consecutive year, according to the World Anti-Doping Agency‚Äôs annual report published on December 16.

title: Public satisfaction is true measure of officials' performance, says Naidu
content: Chandrababu Naidu announces that he will make surprise field inspections from January to see to what extent the government‚Äôs promises are being delivered, at the valedictory of the Collectors‚Äô Conference

title: Shivakumar to inquire into ‚Äòdiversion‚Äô of Bhima waters by Maharashtra
content: The Deputy Chief Minister was replying to a question raised by member Talawar Sabanna under Rule 330 in the Legislative Council in Belagavi

title: Coast Guard¬†apprehends 2 Bangladeshi fishing boats
content: The boats were apprehended during routine surveillance operations in the northern Bay of Bengal and were found to be carrying 35 crew members, along with active fishing gear and approximately 500 kilograms of fish catch on board

title: Man charred to death as parked car catches fire in Palakkad
content: Local people find a car engulfed in flames on the roadside along the Dhoni-Mundur stretch near Arimani Estate

title: Jagan Mohan Reddy ‚Äòmisleading‚Äô people on PPP model of developing medical colleges, says Health Minister Satya Kumar
content: Condemning the ‚Äòthreats‚Äô allegedly made by the YSRCP chief to the companies involved in the construction of the colleges, the Minister challenged him to seek a CBI inquiry, or legal action, if he has proof of any wrongdoing

title: Former ISRO Chairman expresses concern over competence and capability of start-ups to innovate in aerospace
content: Somanath says that classical approaches still continue and integration of artificial intelligence in practice is not happening

title: Jagan complains to Governor against PPP model for medical colleges
content: YSRCP will challenge the matter in the court if the State government does not withdraw the decision, says party president

title: IFFK 2025 | ‚ÄòA Sad and Beautiful World‚Äô movie review: a romantic drama explores love and resilience amid conflicts
content: Lebanese filmmaker Cyril Aris‚Äôs debut feature highlights the beauty of enduring relationships while reflecting the fragility of life in conflict.

title: Journalists trapped inside as Bangladesh media houses torched; mobs storm Dhaka offices
content: Widespread unrest erupted in Bangladesh following the death of youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi, a critic of former PM Sheikh Hasina. Protests turned violent in Dhaka, with attacks on major media houses and the Indian deputy ambassador's residence. Hadi was shot last month, just before elections he intended to contest.

title: VB - G RAM G row: Oppn sleeps outside Parliament in protest - watch video
content: Opposition parties staged an overnight dharna in Parliament protesting the passage of the VB-G RAM G Bill, which replaces MGNREGA. MPs accused the government of rushing the legislation without debate, calling it an insult to the poor and a murder of democracy. The government defended the new law, citing its necessity for rural development and employment.

title: 'Felt bad, was doing well': Ishan Kishan breaks silence on India snub; stresses patience
content: Ishan Kishan's explosive 101 off 49 balls powered Jharkhand to their maiden Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy title. The wicketkeeper-batter, who finished as the tournament's leading scorer, broke his silence on his national team absence, emphasising hard work and self-belief over expectations. Kishan's dominant performance and leadership secured a memorable victory for his side.

title: Meta CEO Zuckerberg's 'highest-paid' employee reportedly unhappy with his Boss
content: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.

title: Bangladesh: Who was Sharif Osman Hadi? Key figure in Sheikh Hasina ouster
content: Sharif Osman Hadi, a prominent leader of the July Uprising that ousted Sheikh Hasina, has died in Singapore after being shot in Dhaka. Hadi, spokesperson for Inqilab Mancha, was targeted while campaigning and succumbed to severe brain injuries. His death has ignited widespread protests and calls for justice.

title: Rupee continues to rebound! Currency opens 0.1% up; trades at 90.1 against US dollar
content: The Indian rupee experienced an upward trend against the US dollar on Friday, following a period of significant depreciation. This recovery is largely attributed to the Reserve Bank of India's strategic dollar sales, aimed at curbing one-way currency weakness.

title: Kristin Cabot speaks out: Woman on Coldplay kiss cam with CEO boss finally breaks her silence
content: A human resources executive, Kristin Cabot, has broken her silence after being filmed embracing her married CEO boss on a giant screen at a Coldplay concert. She described the moment as a single, alcohol-fueled mistake, not a sexual relationship, and has since faced intense public shaming and death threats.

title: Warner Bros to Oracle's Larry Ellison on Paramount offer: Your trust isn't enough, we want...
content: Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) has rejected Paramount Skydance's $108 billion hostile takeover bid, deeming it "misleading" and "inadequate." WBD's board urged shareholders to reject the offer, citing financial concerns and a lack of a strong personal guarantee from Larry Ellison. The company reiterated its preference for a merger agreement with Netflix, which it considers superior and more transparent.

title: IND vs SA: Shubman Gill travels with team to Ahmedabad; stage set for fifth T20I
content: Shubman Gill's participation in the series decider against South Africa is uncertain. The Indian vice-captain sustained the blow during a net session prior to the fourth match and was unlikely to feature in Wednesday‚Äôs game in Lucknow, which was eventually washed out because of adverse weather.

title: Brown Univ shooting: Who was Claudio Manuel Neves-Valente? Suspected gunman from Portugal found dead
content: The suspected shooter in the Brown University shooting, identified as Claudio Manuel Neves-Valente, was found dead from a self-inflicted gunshot wound. Authorities are investigating potential links between this incident and the death of another Portuguese national in Massachusetts, with a rental car seen at both locations. The FBI has offered a reward for information.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex up around 350 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in green on Friday on positive global cues. While Nifty50 went above 25,900, BSE Sensex was up around 350 points.

title: Amazon layoffs: Biggest ever job cuts in Europe; these roles are impacted the most
content: Amazon is cutting 370 jobs, or 8.5%, at its European headquarters in Luxembourg, impacting software developers most significantly. This move follows global layoffs and a push towards AI, though Luxembourg remains a strategic European partner for the company. Affected employees will receive comprehensive support packages.

title: China to get Nvidia H200 chips! Trump admin begins licensing process for exports
content: The US government is initiating a formal licensing process that could allow Nvidia to ship its H200 AI chips to China, following President Trump's commitment to permit such sales. This move aims to retain US companies' edge over Chinese chipmakers, though concerns about national security and Beijing's military capabilities persist.

title: Dhurandhar ends week 2 with Rs 253.5 crore haul; crosses Rs 700 crore at global BO
content: Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna's 'Dhurandhar' achieved a historic second week at the box office, amassing Rs 253.5 crore net and becoming the highest-grossing second week for a Hindi film. The spy thriller crossed Rs 500 crore gross in India in just 13 days, now standing at Rs 460.

title: Delhi's AQI remains ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô at 330; flights delayed amid dense fog
content: Delhi is grappling with hazardous air quality, with Anand Vihar recording a 'severe' AQI of 442. Dense fog has also disrupted flight operations at the airport. Transport is identified as the primary contributor to the city's pollution, with neighbouring NCR districts also significantly impacting air quality.

title: Maple Leafs fans uneasy after report hints Auston Matthews trade talks near
content: Maple Leafs captain Auston Matthews is facing scrutiny as his scoring has slowed. This has sparked discussions about his future with the team. Toronto management must navigate this delicate situation. The coming months will be crucial for both Matthews and the Maple Leafs' legacy. The team aims for immediate success.

title: How Jeffrey Epstein got rich: Lies, luck, sex, scams and secrets
content: Democrats have unveiled disturbing photos from Jeffrey Epstein's estate, intensifying calls for the Justice Department to release sealed files. The images offer a glimpse into his network and alleged crimes, including explicit tattoos and redacted IDs. This release is another attempt by Democrats to put pressure on authorities to disclose records concerning the late financier's activities and wealth accumulation.

title: Lamborghini Urus, Mercedes: ED raids YouTuber Anurag Dwivedi
content: Enforcement Directorate officials seized luxury vehicles from a Uttar Pradesh-based YouTuber. The action is part of a money laundering investigation. This probe is linked to suspected illegal online betting networks. Searches were conducted at multiple locations. Documents related to Dubai real estate investments were recovered. The YouTuber is believed to be living in Dubai and has ignored summons.

title: Braun Strowman & Raquel Rodriguez net worth 2025: WWE earnings, lifestyle
content: Braun Strowman and Raquel Rodriguez showcase contrasting WWE financial journeys in 2025. Strowman, a former headliner, boasts an estimated net worth of $2-5 million, built on lucrative deals and merchandise. Rodriguez, a rising star, has a projected $700,000, with her value steadily increasing through television exposure and championship opportunities.

title: Inside Josh Allen‚Äôs luxury car collection: A look at the Bills star‚Äôs garage
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen's impressive car collection showcases his journey from humble beginnings to NFL stardom. His garage features a mix of rugged trucks like the Ford F-150 Raptor and luxury SUVs such as the Jeep Grand Wagoneer and Range Rover Sport, reflecting his need for utility and comfort in Buffalo's climate.

title: How police secretly tracked missing coach Travis Turner before abuse charges
content: Experts believe fugitive football coach Travis Turner was likely caught through a secret police sting or flagged online activity. Authorities say Turner faces 10 child pornography-related charges. While police remain silent, criminologists told the Daily Mail that undercover officers, tech company reports, or device searches likely led to the case.

title: TikTok row: US joint venture deal signed to avert Chinese ownership ban
content: TikTok has agreed to a joint venture with major investors, including Oracle, to establish a new US-based entity. This move aims to comply with a US law mandating the sale of its American operations or a shutdown, with American and global investors holding over 80% of the new venture.

title: ‚ÄòGambhir is not coach‚Äô: Kapil Dev drops bombshell; weighs in on role of head coach
content: Kapil Dev believes Gautam Gambhir's role is more managerial than coaching, emphasizing player management over technical instruction at the international level. Dev highlighted that a coach's primary duty is to build confidence and create a supportive environment, especially for underperforming players, rather than teaching specialist skills.

title: Hijab row: Pakistan-based gangster threatens Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
content: In a troubling turn of events, Patna police are probing a video threat linked to a gangster from Pakistan who goes by the name 'Shahzad Bhatti.' The threat specifically targets Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar and stems from a controversy over a female doctor being veiled by the CM.

title: Delhi‚Äôs non-BS 6 ban: Chaos, confusion & snarls mark day 1; 2,768 vehicles turned away
content: As the new GRAP Stage IV regulations kicked in, Delhi's borders descended into turmoil. The sudden prohibition on non-Delhi, non-BS 6 vehicles left thousands stranded and confused. Police faced an uphill battle enforcing the ban amidst a sea of vehicles, leading to growing frustration over both the clarity of the rule and its effectiveness in combating pollution.

title: Parliament clears 'G Ram G' Bill: RS passes law hours after LS approval; oppn protests
content: Parliament has passed the Viksit Bharat ‚Äì Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) or VB-G Ram G Bill, 2025, replacing MGNREGA. The new law aims to enhance rural employment by focusing on durable asset creation and transparency, despite opposition protests over alleged removal of Mahatma Gandhi's name.

title: Bondi Beach attack: Australia to take 'moment to pause and reflect'
content: Australia will hold a national day of reflection on Sunday, December 21, following the deadly Bondi Beach mass shooting. Prime Minister Anthony Albanese urged the nation to reject hatred and violence, announcing a national gun buy-back scheme and tougher measures against antisemitism.

title: Gisele B√ºndchen spotted jet skiing in Florida with Joaquim Valente
content: Gisele B√ºndchen and Joaquim Valente embraced a sun-drenched holiday with a jet ski outing near their Florida home, prioritizing family and privacy after welcoming their son. This choice reflects B√ºndchen's current focus on grounding moments and personal strength over public spectacle. Meanwhile, Tom Brady confirmed his NFL retirement is permanent due to his ownership stake in the Raiders.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research highlights Max Healthcare and Sagility as top stock picks for December 19, 2025. Max Healthcare is recommended for its expansion and cash flow growth, targeting ‚Çπ1218. Sagility presents a fresh entry opportunity, aiming for ‚Çπ56, driven by its uptrend and positive structure.

title: GOAT India Tour: Gavaskar slams Messi for Kolkata ruckus - 'Failed to honour commitment'
content: Sunil Gavaskar challenges the narrative blaming Kolkata's Messi event on the organisers. He argues the focus should be on whether Messi himself fulfilled his commitments. Gavaskar suggests that if Messi's team failed to honour agreed-upon activities, they, not local mismanagement, were the primary culprits. He urges checking commitments on both sides before assigning blame.

title: Big update on ticket refunds after Lucknow T20I called off due to fog
content: The UPCA has announced a full refund for spectators after the fourth India-South Africa T20 International was abandoned due to dense fog and smog at Ekana Stadium. Online ticket holders will receive refunds via their original payment method, while offline ticket purchasers can collect theirs from the box office in person with original tickets and ID.

title: IPL 2026: 'Not very professional' - PBKS co-owner slams Josh Inglis over availability
content: Punjab Kings co-owner Ness Wadia slammed Josh Inglis for his "unprofessional" late disclosure of limited availability for IPL 2026 due to his wedding. Wadia expressed disappointment, stating the franchise planned retention around Inglis, only to learn of his brief availability just before the deadline.  Despite criticism, Wadia wished the player well.

title: Business jet crashes at North Carolina airport; 7 killed; video surfaces
content: A Cessna C550 business jet crashed while landing at Statesville Regional Airport in North Carolina on Thursday, resulting in a large fireball at the impact site. First responders were seen at the scene as the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) was en route to investigate the incident. The number of people aboard and any injuries or fatalities were not immediately known.

title: MLB trade rumours: Mariners tipped to land $33.6m elite hitter
content: Seattle Mariners are eyeing Bo Bichette to bolster their offense, aiming to complement their strong pitching staff. Bichette's consistent contact and lineup balance would significantly enhance Seattle's chances of contending for a title. A potential long-term deal, estimated between $180-220 million, or a sign-and-trade are being considered, with Bichette open to playing second base.

title: IndiGo under CCI scanner after mass cancellations of flights
content: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) is investigating IndiGo for potential abuse of dominance and antitrust violations following widespread flight disruptions. The airline, holding over 60% domestic market share, cancelled nearly 5,000 flights, impacting numerous passengers. This probe could lead to fines or other remedies if dominance abuse is established.

title: Exodus: Over 2L Indians renouncing citizenship every year; why are they leaving?
content: Nearly a million Indians have renounced their citizenship in five years, with over two lakh annually since 2022. This trend, raises questions about quality of life, governance, and taxation. While the government cites personal reasons and views the diaspora as an asset, the lack of dual citizenship is a key factor driving this significant outflow.

title: Water crisis: These states are hurtling towards 'Day Zero'; is it too late?
content: India faces a severe water crisis, with 600 million people experiencing extreme stress. Groundwater, the nation's lifeline, is being depleted faster than it replenishes, particularly in agricultural regions. Over-extraction, pollution, and weak regulations are exacerbating the situation, pushing cities and rural areas towards 'Day Zero' scenarios. Urgent action is needed.

title: Yunus declares state mourning for Sharif Osman Hadi, supporters protest in Dhaka
content: Bangladesh observes a day of state mourning following the assassination of youth leader Sharif Osman bin Hadi in Singapore. This comes amidst escalating anti-India protests in Dhaka, with demonstrators demanding an end to alleged conspiracies and the return of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. India has resumed visa services in Dhaka, though some centers remain closed due to security concerns.

title: India's job market in 2026: Where hiring will grow & which skills will matter - explained
content: India's job market is rapidly evolving by 2026, prioritizing skills and digital fluency over tenure. Technology-led roles in data science, AI, and cloud computing are booming, alongside growth in green infrastructure, quick commerce, and precision manufacturing. High paychecks are increasingly linked to specialized digital capabilities and niche technical certifications.

title: Even in retirement, Nick Saban's fingerprints are all over the CFP
content: the only game coaches love more than coaching an actual game is the game of "Hey, who have you coached with?" coach: "he's a helluva guy. And ... the head coach we coached under ... Now, that's the helluv guy and helluvar coach" the college football playoff begins on sidelines and in hotel bars from Oxford to Oregon .

title: Student-athlete: Commanders LB Bobby Wagner graduating with MBA from Howard
content: he finished his coursework for an MBA in business at Howard University last week . he started the 18-month program in January 2024, but he attended classes in person this summer . the linebacker wanted people to know he was serious about business .

title: 'I wish he was still here': Inside Klay Thompson's split from Golden State
content: Curry says it's a "natural instinct" for his eyes to follow Klay Thompson around the court . his son, Canon, delivered his "Hello, Klay" line that became a viral video representing the Splash Brother connection . he was resting at home with Canon, who is now 7 years old and slightly more aware of the complexities of the NBA world .

title: Southall gurdwara property raided by UK police and immigration
content: the property, 11 Beaconsfield Road, is one of eight properties belonging to Sri Guru Singh Sabha Southall . the properties are meant to house staff serving the gurdwara and visiting preachers from india . police have not confirmed what he was arrested for, but a member of the congregation told TOI an Indian-origin Sikh man is arrested for drugs and money laundering .

title: "Swear By My Mother, This Law Isn't Good For Poor": M Kharge On G RAM G Bill
content: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Thursday warned the Centre that people won't let their leaders roam on roads if they end UPA-era Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) scheme.

title: Bangladesh Protests LIVE Updates: Mujibur Rahman's Ancestral Dhanmodi House Vandalised Again
content: Bangladesh Violence LIVE Updates: Bangladesh has been rocked by violent protests since late Thursday after the death of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi, with concerns of further unrest ahead of national elections in the country.

title: "How Dare She...": HR Behind Coldplay Kiss Cam Scandal Slams Gwyneth Paltrow
content: Kristin Cabot, the former Chief People Officer at Astronomer, has been in the news since she was spotted on the "kiss cam" with her then boss, Andy Byron, during a Coldplay concert in July.

title: Trump's New 'Warrior Dividend' To Troops Is Coming From Pentagon Funding, Not Tariffs
content: The "Warrior Dividend" that President Donald Trump announced during his televised address to the nation Wednesday is not a Christmas bonus made possible by tariff revenues, as the president suggested.

title: Kerala Local Body Poll Results: Tales Of Irony, Comedy And Humanity
content: A candidate who bagged only a single vote to a family holding the balance of power in an entire municipality, the Kerala local body election results brought with them tales that were emotional, ironic, and mildly hilarious.

title: Bangladesh On Edge After Student Leader's Death, Media Houses Set On Fire
content: Violent protests broke out in several cities in Bangladesh overnight after the death of radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi.

title: Adults In Live-In Relationship Entitled To Protection Of Life: Allahabad High Court
content: The Allahabad High Court has directed police protection for 12 live-in couples, who said they faced threats from their families and had received inadequate security from the police.

title: "Dangerous Guns Must Go": Australia Announces Buyback Scheme After Bondi Beach Shooting
content: Australia will mark one week since the Bondi Beach mass shooting with a national day of "reflection", Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Friday as he outlined plans for a sweeping gun buyback scheme.

title: "Greatest Strategic Challenge Since 1971": S Tharoor-Led Panel On Bangladesh
content: The current situation in Bangladesh poses the "greatest strategic challenge" for India since the Liberation war of 1971, said a parliamentary committee headed by Congress's Shashi Tharoor.

title: Hijab Row: Bihar Health Minister Unaware Of Doctor's Refusal To Join Duty
content: Bihar Health Minister Mangal Pandey on Thursday said he was not aware of reports that a female doctor had refused to join duty following an incident in which Chief Minister Nitish Kumar was seen publicly removing the veil from her face.

title: Indian Scientists Predict How H5N1 Virus Could Spread To Humans
content: Even as the bird flu virus H5N1 is evolving rapidly, with the potential to become a significant threat to human health, a team of Indian researchers using an Artificial Intelligence (AI)-based model has decoded how the deadly virus can actually spill

title: Congress' Pradnya Satav Joins BJP,  Days Before Maharashtra Local Body Polls
content: Congress leaders leaving the party and joining the BJP is not something that surprises anyone anymore.

title: Suspect Behind Brown University, MIT Shootings Found Dead: Report
content: A man who is suspected of killing two and wounding several others at Brown University has been found dead in a New Hampshire storage facility, a law enforcement said

title: Supreme Court Rejects Salar Jung III Heirs' Claim To Forest Land In Telangana
content: The Supreme Court delivered a major verdict upholding the rights of the Telangana Forest Department over 102 acres of forest land in Ranga Reddy district, rejecting ownership claims made by individuals asserting to be "heirs" of Salar Jung III.

title: "You Are Killing Me": Bangladesh Journalist Trapped In Office Set On Fire
content: It began with an attack on Bengali-language daily newspaper Prothom Alo, where the crowd had gone chanting slogans before setting the building on fire around midnight.

title: 'G Ram G' Bill, To Replace MGNREGA, Clears Parliament, Opposition Stages Overnight Protest
content: The Viksit Bharat Guarantee for Employment and Livelihood Mission (Rural) Bill --- meant to be an updated version of UPA government's flagship MGNREGA was pushed through parliament within two days amid massive turbulence in both houses.

title: No Evidence Pillar Meant For Lighting Lamps: Tamil Nadu To Court On Deepam Row
content: Arguments concluded in the writ appeal over the Thiruparankundram hill lamp dispute, with the Tamil Nadu government opposing a single judges order allowing the petitioner to light a deepam on an ancient stone pillar near the hilltop dargah.

title: Zohran Mamdani Appointee Resigns Over Old Antisemitic Social Media Posts
content: One of New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani 's appointees has resigned over social media posts she made more than a decade ago that featured antisemitic tropes, Mamdani's office said Thursday.

title: TikTok Signs Deal To Sell US Unit To American Investor-Led Venture
content: ByteDance's TikTok has signed a deal to sell its US entity to a joint venture controlled by American investors, according to a memo from TikTok CEO seen by Reuters.

title: 23-Year-Old Shooter Raped At Faridabad Hotel, 3 Arrested: Cops
content: Three people, including a woman, have been arrested in connection with the alleged rape of a 23-year-old female shooter at a hotel here, police said on Thursday.

title: Don't doubt Terence Crawford, even in his retirement from boxing
content: the undefeated boxer retires on his own terms . he's the undisputed champion at 140, 147 and 168 pounds . the great andre Ward left in 2017 after consecutive wins over the boogeyman .

title: Who will squeeze into the NFL playoffs? Let's simulate the rest of the season to find out
content: the Rams and the Broncos have clinched berths, but the remaining 12 postseason teams and the overall seedings remain a murky mystery . we asked the FPI to simulate the last three weeks of the season and come up with the most likely field of 14 playoff teams .

title: Maharashtra NCP minister Kokate resigns; Nashik police in Mumbai with arrest warrant
content: manikrao Kokate resigned from his post in the state cabinet in the wake of his 1995 conviction . sources say no arrest would be made while he was still in hospital . police earlier visited the residence of his brother, who is also facing the warrant .

title: It's a disgrace that Jake Paul vs. Anthony Joshua is a sanctioned fight
content: Otto Wallin, 28, remains a world-class heavyweight, still toiling for that last best shot . he has been in the game for two full decades, turning pro in 2013, and has been stopped by only one man . the two-time unified heavyweight champion, former Olympic gold medalist and among the division's hard-hit heavyweights .

title: TCU QB Hoover to enter portal, miss Alamo Bowl
content: Josh Hoover will be one of the most productive and coveted players available . he plans to have the most passing yards (9,629) and touchdown passes (71) of any player returning to college football next season . "it has been a dream to be able to play and graduate from this university," he wrote .

title: Survivor pool strategy: Bills, Texans among top options in Week 16
content: ESPN Eliminator Challenge is one of the most fun games to play this NFL season . the Texans are being picked in over half of remaining entries early in the week . they are available for 58% of Eliminators Challenge entries .

title: Power Rankings: Louisville in, UNC out of top 16
content: this week they make their debut in the ESPN women's college basketball Power Rankings . the Cardinals are now no. 16, the highest-ranked of the three ACC teams left in the AP poll . they play the Tennessee Lady Vols in Saturday's champions Classic doubleheader at barclays center .

title: How Wallstedt, Bussi and five other NHL goalies leveled up their play this season
content: jesper wallstedt is a Minnesota Wild goaltender who's rewriting the franchise's rookie record books . he's at the top of a goaltending wave bringing new freshmen to light in the season's first half . it's almost a mystery how these things work .

title: Connelly on the CFP first round: Game-by-game previews
content: the first round of last year's inaugural 12-team college football playoff was memorable primarily for the otherworldly atmospheres . the four home teams were favored by an average of 8.8 points but won by 19.3 . we might get a couple of those this time around, too .

title: 'Don't show 6 films': MEA 'warns' Kerala fest; 3 already screened, other 3 to be pulled
content: organisers of international film festival of Kerala 2025 won't show three films . state govt said it would show all films regardless of permission . six films that did not get censor exemption for festival are 'All That's Left of You', 'Yes!' and 'Eagles of the Republic' .

title: Follow live: Seahawks, Rams going to overtime after Seattle overcomes 16-point fourth-quarter deficit
content: The  Los Angeles Rams  (11-3) enter their Week 16 "Thursday Night Football" game at the  Seattle Seahawks  (11-3) as the No. 1 seed in the NFC West and in the conference. Thursday's game could alter that with the Seahawks on their tail. The Rams clinched a playoff berth last week but are playing for the No. 1 overall seed and a wild-card round bye. The Seahawks can clinch a playoff berth with a win Thursday or a  Detroit Lions  loss vs. the  Pittsburgh Steelers  on Sunday. Rams reporter Sarah Barshop and Seahawks reporter Brady Henderson are on-site to provide all the highlights throughout the night right here.
